definition[0]: a severe pain that you get in part of your body when a muscle becomes too tight, making it difficult for you to move that part of your body
example[0]: Several players were suffering from cramp.
example[2]: One of the swimmers got cramp and had to drop out of the race.
definition[1]: to prevent the development of someone or something
example[3]: Stricter anti-pollution laws may cramp economic growth.
definition[2]: to get or cause cramp in a muscle
example[4]: He cramped in the last 200 metres of the race.
example[5]: Sitting still for so long had cramped her muscles.
